document_title: Hyperuricemia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: tang-acid-uric-mau.json_6_Subjects at risk of high uric acid
subsection_content:
Anyone can have high blood uric acid, but studies show that men are more likely to have high uric acid in the blood than women. This may be related to the nature of work and living habits of most men, which are at risk of increasing uric acid in the blood.
Typical factors include heavy alcohol use and heavy physical activity. In addition, some diseases can also contribute to this condition such as kidney disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, hypothyroidism, obesity, and use of drugs to treat cardiovascular disease.
subsection_title: tang acid uric mau.json. Subjects at risk of high uric acid

Typical factors include heavy alcohol use and heavy physical activity. In addition, some diseases can also contribute to this condition such as kidney disease, high blood pressure, diabetes, hypothyroidism, obesity, and use of drugs to treat cardiovascular disease.
